website_summaries.verdict: The Puddle Jumper foam float jacket includes built-in arm rings and chest pad. Easy on, easy off, and it will never deflate.
pros: Durable nylon shell and cross-tech flotation foam construction
Adjustable buckle at the back offers a secure fit
Designed for children weighing 30 to 50 pounds
Allows child to practice in a natural swimming position
No air needed, so no leaks
cons: Bulkier to pack than blow-up arm floats

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Puddle Jumpers from non Amazon vendors
customer_reviews.text: Puddle jumper I received was counterfeit with poor stitching. Attached some photos to compare a real puddle jumper vs the counterfeit (in bottom of photos). There are no Stearns logos on the counterfeit, no distinguishing numbers like Model # or Coast Guard Approval #, its much smaller in size and artwork is clear poorly done. Most importantly this is a safety hazard and a child could drown. This listing is selling both fake and real puddle jumpers so do not buy from any vendor that is not Amazon. Amazon should not allow these vendors to sell these products! I called amazon and they had no way to just stop these vendors from selling here. Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Baby seeks freedom!
customer_reviews.text: He's 10 months-old today, weighing about 8.5 kg/ 19 lbs and has decided that he is too big for a baby floatie ring. He loves the independence of the Puddle-Jumper and independently changes from feet forward to feet under to feet back, all with head out of the water. He deliberately dips his mouth in though to taste the water! I've used these before for kids 15 months to 8 years, but 8 months was a first. He cries in protest if we put him in the baby ring! The Puddle Jumper gives freedom!! Big brother is the sizeof a 6-7 year-old and still wears the same Puddle-Jumper on a looser setting.
customer_reviews.author: Dayyana

customer_reviews.title: Knock off
customer_reviews.text: This claims to be made by Stearns and it is a knock off. You can tell it was poorly made and the labels and warnings are printed wonky. I don't trust putting my child in this since the seller is missing about what brand this actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Knock-off products!
customer_reviews.text: This is a knock-off product. I immediately recognized the lower quality and smaller size when I pulled it out of the bag. We've bought a real Puddle Jumper by Stearns in the past, so I quickly grabbed it to compare. The product they sent me is much smaller in size, flimsy, lacks the tags and Stearns label, and has completely different safety instructions on the back. It has a horrible, acid smell as well and was shipped from China (which took almost a month to get here). I wouldn't trust my kid in it even if it fit, and he's barely 30 lbs. Beware! I'm sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: AlMathews

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!!! My toddler sank!
customer_reviews.text: If I had the option, I wouldn’t leave any stars. My son is 2 years old and weighs between 30-35 pounds. He sank like a rock with this thing on. It didn’t keep him above the water at all!!!! It says that it’s made for 30-50lbs. Absolutely unacceptable!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: but it's great. She can float on her back with them
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter LOVES this and is so confidant in the water when wearing it. My son had one years ago, and I remember not liking them. I'm not sure what has changed since, but it's great. She can float on her back with them, or swim with her belly down, but her head will not go under water. She does go on a slide into the pool sometimes, which causes her to dunk under, but she pops right back up and loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Welch

customer_reviews.title: she weighs 26lbs but fits great with plenty of room to grow into
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 19 month old; she weighs 26lbs but fits great with plenty of room to grow into.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My son really loves to wear his floaty and has been swimming in the pool very well with this. Also worked well at the beach, but I recommend putting a rash guard shirt in the child to protect from sand getting in between the floatie and skin
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Garbage knock off
customer_reviews.text: This was a knockoff. Terrible quality, would never put it on a child. I asked for a refund, they offered me $5 back, when I asked for full refund they offered a 50%. They didn't want me to send it back, which I'm glad, because I'd hate for them to sell it to someone else and have a child drown. Flimsy padding, no labels, no Coast Guard approval. I honestly thought I was buying an older style, until I received it. They are only getting a star, because I can't choose 0.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, did not work- defective/ Unsafe!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several puddle jumpers in the past but this one was cheaper feeling and does not keep my 28lbs son floating. I purchased it early and we just used it and he instantly sank when I started to let go. It is too late to return it or I would.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Zaitshik

customer_reviews.title: Seller sent cheap knock off!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a Stearns product as advertised. If you look at be product picture, there are white letterings on the Stearns product. The product I received has cheap stitching, is very flimsy, and does not have the Stearns name. I have a Stearns product at home so I had something to compare this to. Plus, the information on the product isn’t even correct English!! When will Amazon start holding sellers accountable!!!! I would not trust my child in the water while wearing this cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Knock off-not the real thing-do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the real thing. The label is all wrong compared to the real thing. It doesn't come with any tags. It feels cheap. DO NOT BUY THIS!! Trying to figure out how to get a refund. I am not willing to put my child in it and risk their life.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 20 month old that weighs about 26 ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. Adjustable strap in the back allows for growth. Works great for my 20 month old that weighs about 26 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: clint mobley

customer_reviews.title: Knock off product
customer_reviews.text: This is a knock off. I have a different color of this for my son, and this pink/purple clam one I just received for my daughter is different. There is no "Stearns" lettering on the arms. The foam padding is much less sturdy and I don't trust it to hold my child afloat in the water. There's no wording about "Coast Guard approval" on the inside, like our other one. I will be returning it. It's not safe at all.
customer_reviews.author: E. Demich

customer_reviews.title: Must have for little swimmers
customer_reviews.text: Love love love I have three little kids who can not swim. The 2 & 3 year old love these! And I don't have to be holding them the whole time we are swimming. Gives them a sense of Independence and me room to breath and enjoy the pool too. Beware that it might give your children a false sense of security when not wearing them and you need to always keep them away from water when not supervised. But I do believe these help kids become comfortable with water and build strength to be able to seeing themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these. I won't let them near a pool without wearing one. The are adjustable sizes and durable quality. Comfortable to wear for the kids, and most importantly it's basically impossible for them to go under. They swim for HOURS with these on - no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Terry

customer_reviews.title: Fake!!!BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This item is FAKE. Stearns will say puddle jumper on one arm and Stearns on the other. This says puddle jumper everywhere. The fabric and stitching are not Stearns. What upsets me is that it says USCG approved too and fakes are not and this didn't keep my son above water. This is a hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Appears Authentic
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about authenticity, based on reviews. I don’t have anything to compare the quality to, but it says “sterns” all over it and appears to be authentic. Bought for 21 lb 16 month old and it fits around her, though she could slip her arms out of the wings.
customer_reviews.author: Austin H.

customer_reviews.title: Get the authentic!!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you get the one that says “Stearns” on one arm and not “puddle jumper” on both arms. The first one I ordered was a knock off and cheaply made. I returned it before even trying it on my 3 year old. This one is the authentic Stearns Puddlejumper and I couldn’t be happier with it. It’s adorable, comfortable and most importantly SAFE!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsy Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of knockoffs!
customer_reviews.text: I really wish the reviews went with the actual product. I bought 4 different Puddle Jumpers. Today I got 3 delivered. 2 of them were great! And 1 of them was NOT a Stearns Puddle Jumper. Didn’t have Stearns written on it and it was poorly put together. I am returning that one. I hope the 4th I get is not a knockoff. Please read other reviews so you can be aware of what is a knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Goranden

customer_reviews.title: Use it every pool trip.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good, took my son about 3-4 times in pool to learn how to use it. Not giving 4 stars cause the differences in materials aren’t explained as to what they do. I wish I would have paid more for a better material. My sister has a nicer one and it doesn’t ride up on chest like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli K.

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome floater
customer_reviews.text: My 4y son fell into a pool when he was 2y. It traumatized him. Playing in the water caused him so much anxiety. When his comfort level was finally to a point where he could go in neck high, I slapped this baby on. Not before too long he was letting himself drift away from the stairs. Next he began paddling around. This works great for young kids who want to get into the water but can’t/don’t know how to swim. As a mother it gave me a reassurance that my child could be his rambunctious self even in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: A Jeske

customer_reviews.title: A little big on a 24 lb toddler, but not unusably big
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter is 24 lbs and it is a little big on her (although I realize the suggested size starts at 30 lbs). Looks bulky on her (more than other kids/if she was probably 30 lbs). The body part fits alright. The arm rings fit alright as far as they don't fall off, but they are just a little too long and covers some of her elbow and forearm. I think if she were in the water, the water would keep them up, and she'd be fine. That said - it's not so big that we won't use on her this summer. It will probably fit better the bigger she gets, but it'll work (with supervision) for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knock off product. NOT made by Stearns
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my 3 year old for the pool party. I knew some of the reviews said they got knock off products but since the reviews were overall very good, I was hoping I'd get a genuine brand... but NOPE! Knock off for sure. Stearns logo was nowhere to be found and it had poor stitchings and very tight around the arms even for my skinny 3 year old. I complained to Amazon and asked if there is any way they can control that they send genuine brand (since it clearly says 'stearns' puddle jumper on website) but they said it's internal problem and they can't control it. Very disapointed and I'm returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids and babies. Bad for actually learning how to swim.
customer_reviews.text: Kids really liked this. And this gave me peace of mind when my young children, who didn’t know how to swim, were in the water. But my older child, who was taking swimming lessons, actually regressed. The teacher noticed something strange about his form and asked if he used a floaty and said these puddle jumpers get them used to swimming upright with their heads above water. Which is not how you actually swim. So while this helps young children, it is not great for their actual swimming learning progression. Something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chung

customer_reviews.title: I received an authentic item.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this and was torn. But it was a good price so I said why not. The puddle jumper I received was authentic. I compared it to the one I bought for my other son a couple years ago and it was spot on. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Janeace

customer_reviews.title: Delivered so fast
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was so fast! It fit perfectly and so helpful and not awkward like a life jacjet. Great for our toddler grandkids (a big 1 1/2 year old- its a bit loose on her but still good- and a 3 1/2 year old.) This is the second one I purchased and would highly recommend it. I have spent so much money on every kind of life jacket and swimsuit with built in life jacjket and this is the best. After 5 different types of floating items these are the absolute best!
customer_reviews.author: tropical debbie

customer_reviews.title: Get it for the summer!
customer_reviews.text: Love these for kiddos. It lets them be more independent in the water before they learn to swim. Also a nice safety layer for the beach JUST in case a big wave catches everyone off guard. Of course it doesn't replace adult supervision. It's just a nice aid. Not too bulky and gives them pretty good range of motion. Haven't had a kid slip out of it yet, but one did somehow do a forward flip unintentionally one time. Again, it doesn't replace supervision.
customer_reviews.author: abcreader

customer_reviews.title: WAY better than a life jacket
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my kids have used a Stearn's puddle jumper. They really are amazing. They don't try to move up and choke your child like a life jacket. They can move around and swim so easily in these! I currently have a 2 year old and a 7 year old in one.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Good before they start learning to swim, or when they just want to float
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how the puddle jumper became the "it" thing that every toddler needs for the pool, but once I learned that it exists, I now realize they're everywhere. And for good reason, it seems. They're easy to get on and off, they're comfortable for the kids, and they keep them safe. I was afraid my girl would get too attached and reliant on it, but she's still perfectly comfortable swimming without it. It's just good to have when they're starting out, or when you want to add an extra layer of protection without a full life jacket.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: SCAM - NOT A STEARNS BRAND PRODUCT. CHEAP KNOCKOFF
customer_reviews.text: Total scam. Absolute garbage. NOT A STEARNS BRAND PRODUCT. I wish I would've coughed up the extra 10 bucks for a quality product. So stiff and tight in arms my daughter can't put her arms in. So tight around middle my 2 year old can't wear it. I'd love to know which ones the people who gave good reviews got. We have the polka dot blueberry
customer_reviews.author: Toddler mom 5

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, fake products
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed that these are not real Puddle Jumpers products. Disappointed isn't even a good word. As soon as I saw the two bags from China I knew they weren't real. They are flimsy. They don't even say Stearns or Puddle Jumpers on them at all. What a waste of money and time. No one wants these pieces of crap. Just dish out the money at a regular store so you know you're getting an authentic product. We're pretty angry about this.
customer_reviews.author: stacjlars

customer_reviews.title: FAKE STEARNS PUDDLE JUMPER
customer_reviews.text: This is mis represented as an authentic Stearns Puddle Jumper when in fact it is not made by Stearns and the one I received had no Stearns labeling on it whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I’ve tried so many
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried so many different lifejackets since my toddler was 1. Now this summer turning 2. And this one by far did amazing. Better than the traditional full life vest. Helped him learn to shift weight in water yet keeps him from flipping. He is now not afraid to be in water with life jacket. He has always loved water but hated the traditional life vests as they made him go on his back (he hates that). Now he is jumping in no problem. He hatesssss putting it on and putting arms through (more of the terrible twos problem than the product) but as soon as I snap it together he takes off happy!
customer_reviews.author: mking4892

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these: one pink and one orange. The orange one is clearly counterfeit. The comparison in quality between the two is comical. The counterfeit version has (1) extremely sloppy seems with strings dangling all over the place (2) a really cheap buckle (3) material that’s not even waterproof (4) no Stearns insignias where the real one does have them. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: A. Riden

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE-NOT AUTHENTIC! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item! This is a knockoff. Definitely not made by Stearns. See photos compared to an authentic Stearns product. Feels cheap and stitching is off. Foam material is not as firm as Stearns one. I will not risk putting my toddler in this. This was very upsetting as I purchased for our upcoming Cabo trip and paid for rush shipping, only to find out it was a knockoff. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Perez Family

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad we bought this product. My three-year-old has not taking swim lessons yet because we simply don't have easy access to a pool. But we go to the local YMCA and now that she has this she can feel a little more independent from us in the big kid pool. The only downside of this is that the arm diameter is a little narrow for my child. I stretched it a bit by sticking some shaving cream cans in each hole and let it sit outside for a couple of hours to stretch. But they're pretty tight for the average kid. I guess that's better than being too loose though. Would definitely repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Drummer Boy

customer_reviews.title: FAKE FROM CHINA!!!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I had to make an exception this time. This product is NOT a real Stearns puddle jumper. It is a cheaply-made knock-off from China. It does not say Stearns. It has no tags. There is no coast guard approval! It took several weeks to receive it. We have real puddle jumpers, and this one is a joke! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: My daughter feels confident and so do I
customer_reviews.text: My daughter just turned 4 and feels very comfortable and confident in the water when wearing this floaty, as do I! She can literally get out of the pool and jump into the water from the edge. And depending on the height of where she jumps from (which is never more than about 1 foot if that from the surface of the water) shes never actually been completely under water from head to toe! I feel that these are safe enough that I can lay or sit in a chair by the pool and watch her swim and play on those days when I just dont feel like getting in the pool. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Santos

customer_reviews.title: It fits her well and keeps her a float
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my three-year-old granddaughter. She has a swimsuit with long sleeves. It is very comfortable for her to wear in the pool. She had one close call where in innertube flipped her and this floaty flipped her right back up. She has worn it five times so far this season. It fits her well and keeps her a float. She weighs 30 pounds and it’s an average height child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT at ~ $10
customer_reviews.text: Buyer, PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT at ~ $10. It is not the real Stearns one. I have never reviewed a product on Amazon but I was so upset at this time. I bought a Stearns deluxe jumper life jacket for my little one and planed to buy another for my niece. I was so glad that I could found another Stearns jumper life jacket at $11 and went ahead for it. What I received was the one from China which is cheaply made and I believe it would NOT a safe life jacket for toddlers. I have sent this unqualified one back to China.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Pham

customer_reviews.title: Not Stearns puddle jumper
customer_reviews.text: This is a look alike, but not a Stearns puddle jumper as advertised. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love our puddle jumper
customer_reviews.text: My son (3 years) loves swimming and has been using puddle jumpers since he was 35 pounds. We love that they are coast guard approved. He loves that he has mobility in the water and can "swim" around somewhat naturally (vs. wearing a bulky life vest). This particular purchase was for a second set to keep at the grandparents for when we go boating or swimming.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 5 year old daughter to give her a sense of confidence in the water. She's 46 inches tall and 40 lbs if that will help anybody with sizing. You can see from the photo it absolutely worked and she had a great time exploring the bottom with her goggles on. Stearns is a brand I have known of and trusted since I was young growing up on the water in Florida, and the fit and construction of this flotation device was everything I had come to expect from the company.
customer_reviews.author: NCJohn

customer_reviews.title: A good product, but not always durable
customer_reviews.text: A great product for keeping kids safe while they're learning to swim. We've been using this product since 2009. We've noticed that the stitching binding the arm section to the chest section starts coming undone on the old ones, so we monitor them and stitch them up as needed. Not a big deal, since they were several years old. We bought this product to replace the old ones, expecting them to have the same lifespan of several years. Within just a few uses, the stitching on one side began coming undone. We sewed it up ourselves and are still using the product, but it's pretty annoying to have it start falling apart this quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Boone

customer_reviews.title: Really Small and Not Safe
customer_reviews.text: My son had one of these when he was 3. I got it at a swimming pool store. I found this one online as we are under a stay at home order and it is just not the same. It is made cheaply, and is not exactly safe. The closures come open and it really doesn't keep a child up. It is a drowning hazard and I wouldn't use this. Its basically a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I have a 28lb kid and a 33lb kid and fits perfect for both. Doesn’t sag when wet. I tried the Speedo brand and it was too large. This is my second Stearns floatie purchase and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: k.m.

customer_reviews.title: These are the only ones I buy for my grandchildren
customer_reviews.text: I love these but devices. I started out buying them when my grandsons were at 30 pounds. They are now in their teenage years. I also have a five-year-old granddaughter that when she was right at 30 pounds I bought her one also. She’s five now and weighs 40 pounds and of course is still wearing it. My problem is my grandson is a little over a year old and weighs about 20 pounds and that’s just me guessing. So I wish they would make some that were for 20 pound children.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda tate

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I definitely like the product, but it's not a great fit for my son at this time. He is 21 months and 25 lbs and it's just a bit bulky for him. He prefers the vest life jacket right now, but I think when he is a little bigger and older, he will be fine with this. It's definitely well made and good quality - the design is cute. The color is a little different than what was in the picture, but that's no ones fault - usually colors differ a bit from what they show on a computer! Overall, I would recommend, at least for kids that are around 2 or older.
customer_reviews.author: ERICA B

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my toddler! A+
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I decided to try this floatation device. Life jackets were too bulky for my daughter but arm floaty’s were not enough. We went ahead and ordered this one and she loves it. We feel comfortable enough with her being in the water (with us by her side of course!) and she has now learned how to maneuver and balance her self. I don’t know what took me so long to purchase this but I have 0 regrets. Money well spent!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Fierros

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little swimmers
customer_reviews.text: I love that this product works for little ones who don't swim well and is also a coast guard approved life preserver for use on the boat. Our granddaughter was too big for a floaty tube, but also needed to practice swimming to us. This was perfect. And it was much less cumbersome for wearing in the boat with us. We used a regular life preserver on the jet ski since this product does not keep a child's face out of the water. But we LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: InTune1101

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was light weight and a regular life jacket kept flipping her to her back (not an entirely bad thing especially in emergency situation. But she couldn’t pay very well at all. Enter this device. We tried a different brand. Long short short it sucked. Got this one. Will never go back. I plan to use it for every single kid we have. I truly believe it will hold up that well. It’s light weight but always keeps her above water without restricting any movement so she can play without getting frustrated. Will buy again (if needed). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Krina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little swimmers!
customer_reviews.text: This puddle jumper is leaps and bounds above the regular water wings. The fabric material outside is much better than the plastic that would pull at a kid's skin. The extra chest support also helps keep my child upright, keeping her face out of the water. It does restrict her arms a little bit, as she trouble getting her arms straight in front to grab a kickboard, etc. Other than that, this has been a great tool to help her gain confidence in the pool! It is a good fit for her at 4 years old, 3' 8", and 40lb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Will be buying again!
customer_reviews.text: It’s the only life vest that has worked for my toddler! Definitely will buy another one when the baby is old enough! No worry of drowning I don’t have to be right up on him making sure he doesn’t drown the instant am an inch away! The only chance of his face going under is if he tried to turn from his back to his front. I’m sure even then he couldn’t be under long enough to drown! I was able to enjoy swimming with him and he enjoyed alittle more freedom using for my 2 1/2 yo
customer_reviews.author: Faith Love

customer_reviews.title: Nice support to help your toddler enjoy the pool and start learning to swim.
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter is tiny and she wouldn’t wear it this year. We had purchased same one for my Grandson the year before and he too refused to wear it. Last summer (2019) he wore it and gained the confidence to swim around in the pool and learn strokes and how to kick. I’m sure my granddaughter will wear here’s summer 2020 and do the same! Great product. Just may have to be a bit patient with kids that are hesitant they will adjust to it!
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: worked well for a new swimmer
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my 1.5 year old in the swimming pool. easy to put on & buckle is very secure. definitely trust him to stay head above water while i'm watching him in the pool, but would never ever recommend this as a secure option to leave a child unattended. would also only use a fully approved life vest on a boat or in open water, but this puddle jumper is a great option for us in a standard swimming pool.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction floaties
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14 month old son last year and it was a little too big for him at only 18lbs. I just tried it again this year and apparently there is something wrong with it. Appears to be cut or sewn wrong because now that my son is 2 and almost 30lbs it still falls off his left arm even though it’s snug against his body. The right arm stays up just fine. I used this style of floatation device for years for my older daughter and loved it. Very disappointed that I didn’t figure this out a year ago :(
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My 29 pound 20 month old LOVES this thing. As soon as she sees it, she’s like agua? Agua!!!! I realize that her first experience in the pool is one that was riddled with confidence and I know it’s because she had this on, although I was personally crapping bricks. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not an original "Stearns Original Puddle Jumper Kids Life Jacket"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item with the assumption that I was receiving what they claimed they were selling "Stearns Original Puddle Jumper Kids Life Jacket". However upon inspecting the actual product and comparing it to the one I already have. The actual product and tag is very different from the original Stearns puddle jumper. I've included photos to show the difference between both the original and the knock-off. The packaging, tags and even wording are not the same.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: If you have a toddler that likes the water, then buy this. It is much better than any other style of swim aid that I have seen. Keeps them safe and secure, keeps their head up of of the water, and allows them to move around the water independently. Even better, it is coast guard approved, so it can be used for boating as well, and in public pools and beaches that only allow approved swim aids.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.

customer_reviews.title: Not authentic! Warning, don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Not authentic. I ordered this thinking I was getting a Stearns waterwings, but they ended up being a knock off and fell apart after the first use. The image peeled off after being in the water and the foam inside didn’t hold my toddler up in the water well at all. I went to target and bought the real deal and the difference was huge. Disappointed and now another item/ my money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Daughter LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year-old fell in LOVE with this floatie from the moment she first saw it. Looks alone, it is adorable. Before we got this, we had my daughter wearing one of those vests floats and she absolutely hated it because it wasn't comfortable and did not hold her up well in the water. This floatie, however, is a game changer. She can actually float without being afraid and needing to cling to me. Forget the cheaper floats, you NEED to get this for your kids.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Great! My smaller size 4yr old and thicker 5yr old both fit great in these Stern puddle jumpers. They can even jump off the side of the pool, go under and pop back up easily. Nice back strap and has not hurt their arms like some of the cheaper plastic blowup ones. Highly recommend. ***Obviously never leave the child alone in the water. And this is not a “life jacket” if in the ocean or river. Perfect and comfy for pool.
customer_reviews.author: Amma

customer_reviews.title: We could not live without this for my son!
customer_reviews.text: I had seen several kids at our neighborhood pool wearing these puddle jumpers. My son was terrified of the water prior to purchasing this float. Three weeks after purchasing, he will now jump off the side of the pool into the pool by himself. He is able to swim around as he pleases and enjoy playing. My son just turned 2 in June and it fit him perfectly! Thank you so much for the great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received low quality knock off product
customer_reviews.text: The product I received had poor quality stitching that was fraying already and a cheap buckle. It was also too small for my 4 year old that fits the name brand life vest borrowed at a friends house. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Susan Tam

customer_reviews.title: Always a reliable choice. But I wish they weren’t plastered with pattern prints and animals.
customer_reviews.text: Great. This is the way to go for floaties. BUT will someone in the design department please make this in simple patterns or solid color. Honestly, I’d even pay EXTRA for that. Why does everything have to be so bright and busy and have a animal on it?!
customer_reviews.author: mmargeee

customer_reviews.title: support inadequate
customer_reviews.text: Got this for grandaughter, 27 months, just at 30 pounds. Sleeves are pretty tight, even on this little one. Back has no flotation support, and when I put her in the pool, she went straight onto her back, and her head was just barely out of the water, and she was NOT happy. She's had other floaties and baby rings and liked them all just fine, because they held her upright. This item does not keep a child upright, but rather rests them on their back. Poor design, IMPO. Have ordered an all 'round vest that I think will be much better for her.
customer_reviews.author: Chrispy Chritter

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Fit
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased the same exact model of Stearns child sized life vest for a grandson two years ago, when he was two. He’s still able to comfortably wear it. We purchased another of the same model recently for our one and a half year old grandson and the arm openings on the newer vest are so narrow we can’t even get it on him, and he’s totally miserable if we force it on him. Worthless and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy J. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Stop looking around and make the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great life jacket for my 2 year old. She loves jumping into the pool and she has learned to maneuver and swim pretty quickly while wearing this. Holding up great so far and she has no issues with this while it’s on. She actually knows she needs her “swimmy buddy” and asks for it before getting too close to the pool. Worth every penny and highly recommended for little fish babies!
customer_reviews.author: briannaalynnee

customer_reviews.title: We have been wanting to purchase a puddle jumper for ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been wanting to purchase a puddle jumper for our daughter since last year. She is on the smaller size, around 21-22lbs at 2yrs old, so we were worried it would be too big on her. It fits her perfectly! Even in the water! If you have a small child (weight wise) give it a try. I think you will be surprised at how well it fits
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Kezar

customer_reviews.title: Works well for clumsy babies
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my grandson to play in the river . I was really hoping it would work and be comfortable because the river bottom is solid stone and can be slippery , also the depth of the water varies a lot . My grandson is also a preemie , so he’s not quite as agile in the water as some babies his age . This was perfect . He liked wearing it , it kept him afloat enough that he would hit the stone ground if he slipped or jumped . It even had him jumping into deeper water on his own, which he is normally terrified to do. Super super glad we bought this
customer_reviews.author: LBurleson

customer_reviews.title: Delivery issue
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 at the same time, paid for 2 and only got one delivered. Not the same Amazon quality I am accustomed to. Very disappointed because we are leaving for the Jersey shore in 4 days with our grandchildren, ages 2 and 5 coming from Colorado and now we have only one life saving device. Ordered a new one, hopefully it comes in time and I can get reimbursed for the lost one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Holman

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning swimmers
customer_reviews.text: It is slightly big for my 30 lb 2 year old but I just cinched it tight in the back and he was able to swim in the pool safely. This is so great to initially get kids to be in proper swimming position. He is going to be swimming on his own in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: Product is cute but that's were it ends. I bought this for my daughter who is 2 and weighs pounds. Above the minimum weight and all. We used it this week and the thing will not hold her arms in. Very disappointing as we used one with my oldest and never had issues. We went through a near drowning experience this week and will be seeking other floatuation devices instead of this...
customer_reviews.author: Ajo

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler flotation device there is!
customer_reviews.text: These things really are the best toddler flotation devices out there. I tried another vest/jacket style one and it kept riding up to my sons face when he would jump in or be in deeper water. This one stays put and works really well. It enables him to float on his back or swim on his tummy. I also like that I can hold on to the back strap to drag him around in the water. It's cute and effective and has held up to many many trips to the pool. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kate MahoneyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Safety first!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this life jacket for my 18 month old granddaughter. We have a pool in our back yard and I am very nervous with her back there. At first, I didn't really think it was that good. She was really floundering with it on. Her Mom worked with her a little and she now loves it and loves being in the water with us. We are always in the back yard with her, but if she is in backyard, she has it on. It is a great purchase and I would recommend it to anyone with a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% Real Review
customer_reviews.text: If you see a review from me it’s 100% my experience and I’m only writing this because I read lots of reviews before buying something. This works really well for my 2.5 yr old and is actually better than the other two we have because it holds him higher above the water. It was left outside for months and finally after over a year of use we had to buy a new one due to it tearing. That’s why it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is because it won’t last for years but I don’t expect that from something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be comfortable, but if he's not wearing his rash guard ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have. We have it for our 2 year old son who loves the water. He kind of knows how to swim, but this gives him confidence to swim on his own. It seems to be comfortable, but if he's not wearing his rash guard top sometimes his back is a little irritated near the clip.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for older kids
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for my 1 & 2 year old. I believe it would work with kids that are a little older and know that they need to kick and move to stay above the water, if you don’t then the swimming pads push the body forward in a swimming position and they would swallow water. I had to return them, the speedo brand swimming pads worked better for my 1 & 2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Tobar

customer_reviews.title: Great "floaties"
customer_reviews.text: I don't care what "professionals" say about these floaties, they made our swimming experience with toddlers much more fun! A little hard to get on, but once they are, they kids love them, they stay upright in the water and arew fun for the kids. You still need to watch the kids (like a hawk!) when they are in the pool, but these make their experience much more fun.
customer_reviews.author: emzacsco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome - my almost 2 year old (at almost 30 lb) wore this for a recent vacation to Florida. On the first day in the pool, she screamed and fought me when I put it on...but by the second day she happily wore it after discovering she could now float by herself. I wouldn't leave her alone in this of course, but it's a great float and made me more relaxed knowing that she wouldn't immediately sink if she stepped off the side into the pool. It was funny too because there were lots of toddlers at our vacation and 90 percent were wearing the same style!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi NJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this!!! Fits well and is an awesome buy. Ordered the night before with prime and got the next day for a small cost, One that would’ve added up the same hat I have purchased in the store. It kept me from driving and looking around town for myself only to come up short. This particular style have the option for same-day ship, Which is even better!
customer_reviews.author: Deziluv

customer_reviews.title: Very good, we have three!
customer_reviews.text: We really like these and have ordered three now. So, don’t let the one missing star deter you from buying! I docked the one star because it appears that on the one of the three we received, one of the arms is only sewn about half of the length it should be. This does not affect usability on any way, but we question whether it may last as long as the others.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Buhner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for swimming
customer_reviews.text: These work well to keep my 2 year old's head above water. We've used the around the waist ones from the YMCA when taking him for swim lessons. I like the puddle jumper because it keeps his head up and I can let go of him and watch him move his arms and legs a lot more than when I have an arm out to support him during swim lessons. I think teaching him with my support and without my support will help develop him into a more confident swimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Phillips

customer_reviews.title: PURCHASE IN STORE ONLY
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. For something that is supposed to help young swimmers this was poorly out together. The foam inside separated on the second use. The arm sleeves slide right off and the fabric covering the front is completely twisted so the inside writing is where the shark should be . Do not purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Super dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Amazon needs to stop selling these. Also don’t think for a second about buying this! I took my 21 month old to the swimming hole today and tried this and it tipped him over onto his belly face down in the water and he couldn’t get up right! THIS IS NOT A PUDDLE JUMPER DO NOT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Feels safe, doesn’t water log
customer_reviews.text: I feel safe when my children wear this. It’s good quality. The buckle is strong. My kids cannot get this off themselves and also need help getting it on. It’s very light weight when dry and doesn’t get water logged when wet, so it’s only a little heavier when wet. This one did not fade like some others we have (same Brand but different color). My kids are not good swimmers yet but this keeps them afloat while they are learning to swim- I always stay within reach.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie P.

customer_reviews.title: Great floatie, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing floatie. Fits great, doesn't ride up in to his face. Was worried about the negative reviews stating some received orders were knock off cheap off brand replicas from China. Some one was kind enough to include comparison pics in their review (thank you!) So I knew what to look for. Item received was authentic, I'm thinking the knock offs were possibly the color options that are listed suspicuously cheaper- like $7 not prime, but free shipping, versus $20 they normally go for and include free 2 day prime shipping. Very happy with it, he had a ball at the pool!!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer0418

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our daughter that is just slightly under the weight for this but we are glad she will be able to use it for several years. She loves it- keeps her afloat great. Doesn't have a ton of range of motion with the sleeves (can feed herself or drink when its on) but I think that will get better when she gets bigger! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Sito

customer_reviews.title: This is such an awesome invention!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome invention!! We took two on our vacation for a 2 and 4 year old. They fit perfectly on both and they were little fishies that enjoyed the water SO much. The 4 year old especially loved the independence it gave him to kick around and float all over the place. We would obviously always stay right next to him but we literally spent hooours in the ocean and he preferred to kick around than always hold our hands and this allowed him to do it safely.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome child float!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I was skeptical about how well it would work to keep my toddler afloat. I have to say, it works better than any other floatie we’ve used. It works better in the pool than his life vest. His life vest always tends to tip him forward in the water and he can’t stay upright by himself. But this gives him the stability to maneuver himself through the water with little help.
customer_reviews.author: Jjacks15

customer_reviews.title: Knock off
customer_reviews.text: Not a Stearns brand. It does look like the photo but we have a different Stearns Puddle Jumper and this new one is clearly not an authentic Stearns. I'd return it but I don't see how I could order another and not get stuck with another counterfeit one.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Not for a 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: This works well for 3 year olds that have a little more weight on them. My two year old is 30 lbs and he wasn't able to keep afloat with this device. I recommend 3-4 year olds in this device though. Seems they have more weight and length to keep their head out of the water. It pulls the 2 year old front face in the water. Not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Parks

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this! We had cousins who used these at a hotel while we were trying to use a lifejacket. They offered to let us try them on our kids... SOOO much better than a lifejacket. Somehow they teach the kids to balance properly so that they will learn to swim at a younger age. Please try them. Honestly. Watch some YouTube videos on it if you don't believe me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Take it when you travel - takes up space, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure I don’t need to join the chorus of positive reviews. However I’ll give a few points others might not have mentioned. Our kids got more confident in the water after wearing the puddle jumper. It’s WAY better than a life vest. It tilts them forward instead of having them float straight up. In no way am I being scientific here - however it feels closer to actual swimming than wearing a life vest. Most resorts only have life vests. It takes up room. But just pack it. It’s SO worth it.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Mama

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these for little ones aged 22 months up to 5 years old. The babies took some time getting used to them and learning how to stay upright, but they were able to master them with practice. They are loose on the skinny baby who is very small for age (he can get out of arms himself when dry), so they require close supervision, but they still work well and he loves being more independent in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Fun Life-Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This life jacket is perfect. My grandson liked it when he put it on and had tremendous confidence while using it. The way the life jacket rolls him onto his back/face up when he's just floating surprised him at first, but by the end of the weekend it was like, "Oh yeah. Ok. I just need to kick or move my arms to get upright. This is the biggest improvement in toddler life jackets in my lifetime -- and I'm 60. A literally life-saving life-jacket. And it's fun-looking and comfortable. It doesn't get any better than this!
customer_reviews.author: MandSWinOK

customer_reviews.title: 16 Month Old LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, we were a little hesitant, I heard mixed reviews about this style, but after thoroughly reading pros, cons, and reviews decided to give this brand a try for my 16 month old. She freaking loves it! Slightly Rocky first time, but by the second attempt she figured out her body and felt more comfortable. We were so shocked how quickly she was solo swimming with it. I'm so happy we got this and I know our independent daughter is beyond stoked on it. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Erin Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Product's safety is priceless
customer_reviews.text: Took my first child to the beach and as a former lifeguard am always on "guard" and always on alert. This device allowed me to relax a little as I could tell it was made of quality material and design. I've used the original vests before and they push my son's face forward in the water because he hasn't learned balance yet. That's dangerous. This device doesn't require the child to be able to balance themselves It allowed my son to feel confident in the water and his skills improved every day. Would highly recommend. 5-stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Anne R.

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this
customer_reviews.text: My son is terrified of being in the water without clinging to me like a little cat in a bathtub. This life jacket helped him get more comfortable and confident, and he has almost learned to swim. We were worried it wouldn’t fit because he’s about 42” tall and right around 50-55lbs, but it actually fits him perfectly with a little bit of room to grow. This will most likely be the last summer for it but we have plenty of cousins who can use it.
customer_reviews.author: kkTop Contributor: Makeup

product_meta.title: Stearns Original Puddle Jumper Kids Life Jacket | Life Vest for Children
product_meta.description: Kids love the playful designs on the Stearns Original Puddle Jumper Kids Life Jacket Vest, while parents appreciate the U.S. Coast Guard-approved safety features that the authentic orginal offers. Whether they’re in the pool, at the beach, or on a boat, kids move and swim freely, get a confidence boost if they are learning how to swim, and pick up valuable water safety habits they can use for life. For greater peace of mind, the Original Puddle Jumper's safety buckle snaps in the back to keep kids from taking vests off on their own; be sure to tighten the adjustable strap for a secure fit.
feature_bullets: Meet strict requirements for use on boats, in public pools, and at water parks that require Coast Guard-approved devices
Playful designs make water safety fun for kids
Give beginners confidence when learning how to swim
Designed to fit snugly for added safety
Comfortable styling lets kids move and play freely in or near the water
Safety buckle snaps in the back so kids can't remove vests on their own (when properly tightened)
Adjustable strap offers a secure fit to children 30 to 50 lb.
Made in the U.S.A. of domestic and foreign components
The Stearns Original Puddle Jumper Life Jackets have been tested and approved by the U.S. Coast Guard for use as Type V/III personal flotation devices in, on, or near the water
